poem:
"King of Screens"

In a world that splinters, fractured, sore,
Emerges Godzilla, from the ocean floor.
Very fifth act, a monstrous roar,
A vast spectacle we can't ignore.
Warner's weave of cinematic lore,
Brings unity, eases the social sore.
An uncertain world finds a steady core,
In a city-crushing dinosaur. 
Streamed from the vast and boundless cloud,
A monster rises, fierce and proud.
